page.title: 13EILEAN DONAN CASTLE,DORNIE
page.content: Eilean Donan Castle is the main tourist attraction in the area.It welcomes visitors from all over the world and its photograph is to be seen on many calendars, biscuits tins and sweets boxes.Although it was originally built as a defence against the Vikings it was derelict for over 200 years and was only rebuilt by the grandfather of the present owner in the period 1912 to 1932.There are four people employed three of whom are on a seasonal basis and the custodian who is there all the year round.The custodian is also responsible for maintaining the fabric.The castle is open from Easter to the end of September and gets between 50 and 400 visitors per day.They usually come in cars as the nature of the castle makes it difficult to cope with bus tours.
